HVAC/R Eﬃciency Report
Purpose of Energy Eﬃciency Study
The purpose of this jointly-conducted ECM study between the Major Botanical Garden and PTG engineering teams was 
threefold.  First, to verify the current capacity and efficiency of a 16-year-old water cooled chiller in relation to 
original equipment manufacturer (OEM) design specifications.  Second, to demonstrate what, if any, material 
performance changes occur in this same chiller after being treated with PermaFrost NMR ECM.  And third, to 
determine what, if any, financial benefits are associated with any efficiency improvements realized.  
The identification of pilot chiller involved in the study is recorded as follows:
 
• Nominal 300-Ton York Chiller, Mfg. Date: 1999, R-123, 208 volt-3 Phase, Model YTH1B1CE-CHK
ECM Product Brief
PermaFrost NMR® is a multi-patented surface science nanotechnology that uses Nucleo Molecular 
Regenerative (NMR®) technology as its core agent. A sustainable, one-time treatment with no down time 
required, PermaFrost NMR® lasts for the remaining life of any type of climate control system in which it is 
installed.  The direct benefits of PermaFrost NMR® are improved cooling efficiency and increased capacity, 
both of which result in lower overall costs to operate a system and extended equipment life. 
Methodology
After verifying the proper rates of water flowing through the chiller evaporator and condenser barrels before 
beginning the pilot, the subsequent measurements used in the efficiency calculations were collected and 
compiled in accordance with Option B of the IPMVP (International Measurement and Verification Protocol) 
framework. 
The results presented below were formulated by entering the data into the following thermodynamic 
engineering formulas::
 
• kW = Volts * Amps * Power Factor of 1.47/1000 (for 3-Phase) 
 
• kW/Ton = kW / Actual Tonnage 
 
• Coefficient of Performance (COP) = (12 / kW per ton /3.412)
 
• Actual Cooling Tons per Hour = (Evaporator GPM X 8.34 * 60 * Chilled Water Delta T) / 12,000 BTU

Recovered Wasted Energy with PermaFrost NMR® ECM
Like everyone in the world, Major Botanical Garden and the City of New York have the problem of thermal degradation in 
their Chillers and HVAC units. The degraded equipment performance is costing Major Botanical Garden and the City of New 
York significant operational dollars through wasted energy. Despite its very low annual runtime hours 
compared to other chillers in the geographical region who run as much as three times the amount of hours, 
the pilot chiller was found to be using significantly more 
energy to operate than when it was new.

Energy Consumption & Financial Metrics
The following are the final calculated average performance measurements following the PermaFrost NMR® 
Post measurement period for the Major Botanical Garden chiller.
Baseline Energy Consumption
Baseline Tonnage: 273 tons
Adjusted kW Baseline: .66 kW/ton * 334 tons = 220.4 kW
Adjusted Baseline kWh: 220.4 kW * 960 Annual Operating Hrs = 211,584 kWh
Revised Cost to Run Baseline: 211,584 kWh * $.16 = $33,853
Post Energy Consumption
kW Post: 0.54 kW/ton * 334 tons = 180.4 kW
Annual kWh Post: 180.4 kW * 960 hours = 173,184 kWh
Annual Cost Post: 173,184 kWh * $.16 cents = $27,709
Savings Per Year
Avoided Energy Cost (savings) Per Year: $33,853 - $27,709 = $6,144
Estimated Energy Savings per Month: $6,144 / 12 = $512
Initial Payback Period
Cost of PermaFrost NMR® installed in the pilot chiller: $24,000
Estimated ROI Period for Major Botanical Garden on the chiller: $24,000 / $512 = 3.9 Years
Annual Internal Rate of Return = 25.6%
Return on Investment Over 5 Years = 128%
Utilizing data collected during the pilot study, to obtain a true avoided energy cost and subsequent payback period for 
Major Botanical Garden for implementing the PermaFrost NMR® ECM, a detailed Regression Analysis is used to calculate the true energy 
savings resulting from the improvement in both capacity and efficiency. Working together, these improvements reduce the 
annual kWh expended in the Post Analysis Period. The ROI comes from determining what the cost to run the chiller was 
when operating at the original energy profile to produce the newly restored amount of available tonnage capacity and then 
subtracting the revised cost to run the chiller at the same restored tonnage after the PermaFrostNMR® ECM was 
installed. This regression analysis is the most widely accepted method of accounting for the reduced number of hours or 
load % the chiller will now operate due to the restored performance profile. This restored performance profile allows the 
chiller to satisfy the internal building load with increased efficiency resulting in reduced compressor demand loading.

Major Botanical Garden is Saving More than Just Energy
By treating just this single chiller with PermaFrost NMR®, based on the manner in which the pilot chiller is 
currently being operated, Major Botanical Garden and the City of New York will save approximately 38,400 kWh per year and 
all the costs associated with those savings. From an environmental impact standpoint, Major Botanical Garden will also 
benefit the surrounding communities in which they operate.  Imagine the positive environmental impacts of 
treating the rest of the Major Botanical Garden and all the government buildings in the entire City of New York.
